reactor

Class Environment

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.Environment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Iterable<Map.Entry<String,List<Dispatcher>>>

    public class Environment
extends Object
implements Iterable<Map.Entry<String,List<Dispatcher>>>, Closeable
    Author:
    Jon Brisbin, Stephane Maldini, Andy Wilkinson

      Constructor and Description

      Creates a new Environment that will use a PropertiesConfigurationReader to obtain its initial configuration.

      Creates a new Environment that will use the given configurationReader to obtain its initial configuration.
      Environment(Map<String,List<Dispatcher>> dispatchers, ConfigurationReader configurationReader)
      Creates a new Environment that will contain the given dispatchers, will use the given configurationReader to obtain additional configuration.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Environment

        public Environment()
        Creates a new Environment that will use a PropertiesConfigurationReader to obtain its initial configuration. The configuration will be read from the classpath at the location META-INF/reactor/default.properties.

      • Environment

        public Environment(ConfigurationReader configurationReader)
        Creates a new Environment that will use the given configurationReader to obtain its initial configuration.
        Parameters:
        configurationReader - The configuration reader to use to obtain initial configuration

      • Environment

        public Environment(Map<String,List<Dispatcher>> dispatchers,
                   ConfigurationReader configurationReader)
        Creates a new Environment that will contain the given dispatchers, will use the given configurationReader to obtain additional configuration.
        Parameters:
        dispatchers - The dispatchers to add include in the Environment
        configurationReader - The configuration reader to use to obtain additional configuration

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static Environment initialize()
        Create and assign a context environment bound to the current classloader.
        Returns:
        the produced Environment

      • initializeIfEmpty

        public static Environment initializeIfEmpty()
        Create and assign a context environment bound to the current classloader only if it not already set. Otherwise returns the current context environment
        Returns:
        the produced Environment

      • assign

        public static Environment assign(Environment environment)
        Assign an environment to the context in order to make it available statically in the application from the current classloader.
        Parameters:
        environment - The environment to assign to the current context
        Returns:
        the assigned Environment

      • alive

        public static boolean alive()
        Read if the context environment has been set
        Returns:
        true if context environment is initialized

      • get

        public static Environment get()
                       throws IllegalStateException
        Read the context environment. It must have been previously assigned with this#assign(Environment).
        Returns:
        the context environment.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no environment initialized.

      • terminate

        public static void terminate()
                      throws IllegalStateException
        Clean and Shutdown the context environment. It must have been previously assigned with this#assign(Environment).
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no environment initialized.

      • timer

        public static Timer timer()
        Obtain the default timer from the current environment. The timer is created lazily so it is preferrable to fetch them out of the critical path.

        The default timer is a HashWheelTimer. It is suitable for non blocking periodic work such as eventing, memory access, lock=free code, dispatching...

        Returns:
        the root timer, usually a HashWheelTimer

      • sharedDispatcher

        public static Dispatcher sharedDispatcher()
        Obtain the default dispatcher from the current environment. The dispatchers are created lazily so it is preferrable to fetch them out of the critical path.

        The default dispatcher is considered the root or master dispatcher. It is encouraged to use it for non-blocking work, such as dispatching, memory access, lock-free code, eventing...

        Returns:
        the root dispatcher, usually a RingBufferDispatcher

      • cachedDispatcher

        public static Dispatcher cachedDispatcher()
        Obtain a cached dispatcher out of this#PROCESSORS maximum pooled. The dispatchers are created lazily so it is preferrable to fetch them out of the critical path.

        The Cached Dispatcher is suitable for IO work if combined with distinct reactor event buses .EventBus or streams Stream.

        Returns:
        a dispatcher from the default pool, usually a RingBufferDispatcher.

      • dispatcher

        public static Dispatcher dispatcher(String key)
        Obtain a registred dispatcher. The dispatchers are created lazily so it is preferrable to fetch them out of the critical path.

        The Cached Dispatcher is suitable for IO work if combined with distinct reactor event buses .EventBus or streams Stream.

        Parameters:
        key - the dispatcher name to find
        Returns:
        a dispatcher from the context environment registry.

      • dispatcher

        public static Dispatcher dispatcher(String key,
                                    Dispatcher dispatcher)
        Register a dispatcher into the context environment.
        Parameters:
        key - the dispatcher name to use for future lookups
        dispatcher - the dispatcher to register, if null, the key will be removed
        Returns:
        the passed dispatcher.

      • newDispatcherLike

        public static Dispatcher newDispatcherLike(String key)
        Register a dispatcher into the context environment.
        Parameters:
        key - the dispatcher configuration name to use to inherit properties from
        Returns:
        the new dispatcher.

      • newDispatcherLike

        public static Dispatcher newDispatcherLike(String key,
                                           String newKey)
        Register a dispatcher into the context environment.
        Parameters:
        key - the dispatcher configuration name to use to inherit properties from
        newKey - the dispatcher name to use for future lookups
        Returns:
        the new dispatcher.

      • newDispatcher

        public static Dispatcher newDispatcher()
        Register a dispatcher into the context environment. If it Unsafe friendly, will register a ringBuffer dispatcher, otherwise a simple MP-SC dispatcher. Will use a capacity of 2048 backlog elements.
        Returns:
        the new dispatcher.

      • newDispatcher

        public static Dispatcher newDispatcher(int backlog)
        Register a dispatcher into the context environment. If it Unsafe friendly, will register a ringBuffer dispatcher, otherwise a simple MP-SC dispatcher.
        Parameters:
        backlog - the dispatcher capacity
        Returns:
        the new dispatcher.

      • newDispatcher

        public static Dispatcher newDispatcher(String key,
                                       int backlog)
        Register a dispatcher into the context environment. If it Unsafe friendly, will register a ringBuffer dispatcher, otherwise a simple MP-SC dispatcher.
        Parameters:
        key - the dispatcher name to use for future lookups
        backlog - the dispatcher capacity
        Returns:
        the passed dispatcher.

      • newDispatcher

        public static Dispatcher newDispatcher(int backlog,
                                       int consumers)
        Register a dispatcher into the context environment. If consumers greater than 1 and Unsafe is available, will register a WorkQueue Dispatcher, otherwise delegate to newDispatcher(String, int)
        Parameters:
        backlog - the dispatcher capacity
        consumers - the dispatcher number of consumers
        Returns:
        the new dispatcher.

      • newDispatcher

        public static Dispatcher newDispatcher(String key,
                                       int backlog,
                                       int consumers)
        Register a dispatcher into the context environment. If consumers greater than 1 and Unsafe is available, will register a WorkQueue Dispatcher, otherwise delegate to newDispatcher(String, int)
        Parameters:
        key - the dispatcher name to use for future lookups
        backlog - the dispatcher capacity
        consumers - the dispatcher number of consumers
        Returns:
        the passed dispatcher.

      • newDispatcher

        public static Dispatcher newDispatcher(int backlog,
                                       int consumers,
                                       DispatcherType dispatcherType)
        Register a dispatcher into the context environment.
        Parameters:
        backlog - the dispatcher capacity
        consumers - the numbers of consumers
        dispatcherType - the dispatcher type
        Returns:
        the new dispatcher.

      • newDispatcher

        public static Dispatcher newDispatcher(String key,
                                       int backlog,
                                       int consumers,
                                       DispatcherType dispatcherType)
        Register a dispatcher into the context environment.
        Parameters:
        key - the dispatcher name to use for future lookups
        backlog - the dispatcher capacity
        consumers - the numbers of consumers
        dispatcherType - the dispatcher type
        Returns:
        the new dispatcher.

      • cachedDispatchers

        public static DispatcherSupplier cachedDispatchers(String key)
        Obtain a dispatcher supplier into the context environment. Its main purpose is to cache dispatchers and produce them on request via Supplier.get().
        Parameters:
        key - the dispatcher factory name to find
        Returns:
        a dispatcher factory registered with the passed key.

      • cachedDispatchers

        public static DispatcherSupplier cachedDispatchers()
        Obtain the default dispatcher supplier from the context environment. Its main purpose is to cache dispatchers and produce them on request via Supplier.get().
        Returns:
        a dispatcher factory registered with the default key.

      • cachedDispatchers

        public static DispatcherSupplier cachedDispatchers(String key,
                                                   DispatcherSupplier dispatcherSupplier)
        Register a dispatcher supplier into the context environment. Its main purpose is to cache dispatchers and produce them on request via Supplier.get().
        Parameters:
        key - the dispatcher name to use for future lookups
        dispatcherSupplier - the dispatcher factory to register, if null, the key will be removed
        Returns:
        a dispatcher from the default pool, usually a RingBufferDispatcher.

        public String getProperty(String key,
                          String defaultValue)
        Gets the property with the given key. If the property does not exist defaultValue will be returned.
        Parameters:
        key - The property key
        defaultValue - The value to return if the property does not exist
        Returns:
        The value for the property

      • getProperty

        public <T> T getProperty(String key,
                         Class<T> type,
                         T defaultValue)
        Gets the property with the given key, converting it to the required type using the standard converters. fF the property does not exist defaultValue will be returned.
        Parameters:
        key - The property key
        type - The type to convert the property to
        defaultValue - The value to return if the property does not exist
        Returns:
        The converted value for the property

      • getDefaultDispatcher

        public Dispatcher getDefaultDispatcher()
        Returns the default dispatcher for this environment. By default, when a PropertiesConfigurationReader is being used. This default dispatcher is specified by the value of the reactor.dispatchers.default property.
        Returns:
        The default dispatcher

      • getCachedDispatcher

        public Dispatcher getCachedDispatcher()
        Returns a default cached dispatcher for this environment. By default, when a PropertiesConfigurationReader is being used. This default dispatcher is specified by the value of the reactor.dispatchers.dispatcherGroup property.
        Returns:
        The next available dispatcher from default dispatcher group
        Since:
        2.0

      • getCachedDispatchers

        public DispatcherSupplier getCachedDispatchers()
        Returns the default dispatcher group for this environment. By default, when a PropertiesConfigurationReader is being used. This default dispatcher is specified by the value of the reactor.dispatchers.dispatcherGroup property.
        Returns:
        The default dispatcher group
        Since:
        2.0

      • getCachedDispatchers

        public DispatcherSupplier getCachedDispatchers(String name)
        Returns the dispatcher factory with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the dispatcher factory
        Returns:
        The matching dispatcher factory, never null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the dispatcher does not exist

      • getDispatcher

        public Dispatcher getDispatcher(String name)
        Returns the dispatcher with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the dispatcher
        Returns:
        The matching dispatcher, never null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the dispatcher does not exist

      • routeError

        public void routeError(Throwable throwable)
        Route any exception to the environment error journal this#errorConsumer.
        Parameters:
        throwable - The error to route

      • assignErrorJournal

        public Environment assignErrorJournal()
        Assign a default error Consumer to listen for any call to this#routeError(Throwable). The default journal will log through SLF4J Logger onto the category "reactor-environment".
        Returns:
        This Environment

      • assignErrorJournal

        public Environment assignErrorJournal(Consumer<? super Throwable> errorJournal)
        Assign the error Consumer to listen for any call to this#routeError(Throwable).
        Parameters:
        errorJournal - the consumer to listen for any exception
        Returns:
        This Environment

      • getRootBus

        public EventBus getRootBus()
        Returns this environments root Reactor, creating it if necessary. The Reactor will use the environment default dispatcher.
        Returns:
        The root reactor
        See Also:
        getDefaultDispatcher()

        public Timer getTimer()

        Returns:
        the timer.

        public void shutdown()

        See Also:
